channel.title: CNN on sergem's personal public notebook
channel.description: Recent content in CNN on sergem's personal public notebook

item.title: Self-supervised depth and ego motion estimation
item.description: 3D Packing for Self-Supervised Monocular Depth Estimation -------------------------------------------------------------- by Vitor Guizilini, `pdf at arxiv `_, 2020 Learning 1. Depth estimator :math:`f_D : I \rightarrow D` 2. Ego motion estimator: :math:`f_x : (I_t , I_S) \rightarrow x_{t \rightarrow S}` Depth Estimator ===================================== They predict an inverse depth and use a packnet architecture. Inverse depth probably has more stable results. Points far away from camera have small inverse depth that with low precision.

item.title: Which pretrained backbone to choose
item.description: In 2020 which architecture should I use for my image classification/tracking/segmentation/… task? I was asked on an interview that and I didn’t have a prepared answer. I made a small research and want to write down some thoughts. Most of the architectures build upon ideas from ResNet paper Deep Residual Learning for Image Recognition, 2015 Here is some explanation of resnet family:An Overview of ResNet and its Variants by Vincent Fung, 2017.
